**Addendum 8273-15, Return:** Leandro suggested remaining at the cabin until the next morning, but Chief Ibanez demurred, citing the fact that a safe path through the bog had now been determined and the return journey would not take longer than the remainder of the day. Leandro accepted this decision, but insisted on a brief detour half an hour's walk from the cabin first.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
//<Transcript begins.>//

//<Leandro leads at a distance across the increasingly-frozen terrain. Ice on the ground glistens with unnatural brightness. Chief Ibanez and Pilar speak in low tones as they proceed. If Leandro is listening, he gives no indication.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** I'm still not clear on how you knew where to go. 

**Pilar:** Hmm?

**Chief Ibanez:** Don't fucking //hmm// me. I'm the Chief of Pursuit and Suppression, your evasiveness is doomed from the start.

**Pilar:** I was just--

**Chief Ibanez:** Stalling to come up with an excuse, yeah, I know. Too bad. This place is almost impossible to map, and I get the distinct impression you've never actually  been here before. 

**Pilar:** Yeah, well. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Yeah? Well? 

//<Pilar reaches into the back pocket of her jeans, and hands Chief Ibanez a water-damaged paper map. It is drawn in a child's hand.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Saray.

**Pilar:** Yeah. She saw him go, and snuck after him. He made her promise not to tell. 

**Chief Ibanez:** How'd you get her to? 

**Pilar:** I didn't. She came to me. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Why?

//<She pauses.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Because she knew I could save him? 

**Pilar:** No, because she knew you needed to. 

**Chief Ibanez:** I do like that kid.

//<She shakes her head ruefully.>//

**Pilar:** Are you going to forgive him?

//<Leandro looks at the ground. A slight but very broad depression in the earth is now visible ahead.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** It doesn't matter.

**Pilar:** Of course it matters.

**Chief Ibanez:** Sorry, I was doing the thing again.

**Pilar:** What thing?

**Chief Ibanez:** Overcomplication. What I meant to say was it's none of your fucking business.

//<Pilar smiles.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** What?

**Pilar:** You wouldn't be this angry if it didn't still matter to you.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Why not just give me the map, though? 

**Pilar:** Hmm?

**Chief Ibanez:** Why come with?

**Pilar:** You're not the only one who's ever wanted to leave home, Chief.

//<Chief Ibanez nods, seems to consider something, then nods again.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** You can call me Delfina.

//<Leandro looks back at them.>//

**Leandro:** We're here.

//<He is standing at the edge of the depression, which slopes down further into a shallow valley a few metres on . The valley is filled with blackened soil, and the mummified remains of unusual vegetation.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** What is this? 

**Leandro:** The ashes of our last hope. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Less flowery?

**Leandro:** No, that's just it. That's what this is. 

//<Chief Ibanez walks past him to examine the vegetation more clearly. She picks up one of the stalks, and sucks a breath in through her teeth.>//

**Leandro:** This is my //Nigella// plantation.

//<Chief Ibanez mutters the next sentence under her breath.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** No leylines for miles, she said.

**Leandro:** What?

**Chief Ibanez:** Nothing. What's it doing way the hell out here?

**Leandro:** Same thing the cabin is. Been here for generations. The flowers too. Waiting for us to return.

**Chief Ibanez:** And only you knew where it was? Before now?

**Leandro:** The men tend the flowers, and maintain the machine. The women have the visions, and make the decisions. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Nursery rhyme sexism. I guess it's nice to have a mnemonic.

**Pilar:** What happened to them? The flowers, I mean.

**Leandro:** Wouldn't grow. Rotted so badly they scorched the permafrost. All that potential energy had to go somewhere. 

//<He shrugs. The gesture seems forced.>//

**Leandro:** I guess it's possible to be too much a stranger.

**Chief Ibanez:** You planted them?

**Leandro:** I did. That's why I came out here, the first time. When we arrived. I wanted to grow a new crop, so that...

**Pilar:** ...you could go looking for her?

**Chief Ibanez:** So he could get out of this lime-green hellhole.

**Leandro:** Whatever you want to believe.

//<Leandro slouches in a posture of defeat.>//

**Leandro:** I thought I understood the principles. As usual, I was wrong. It takes years for these things to grow, you know. They should have been ready by now. Instead...

**Chief Ibanez:** That's why you didn't go back. To Puerto Extirpado.

**Leandro:** They're better off without me.

**Pilar:** That's not true.

//<Chief Ibanez rotates the desiccated stalk in her fingertips, thoughtfully.>//

**Leandro:** I just... I hoped it would work. But hope isn't always enough.

**Pilar:** But it's fine, right? We don't need them. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Sure. It's fine. 

//<She stands, dropping the stem to the ashen earth. Pilar's camera captures the last of the light from SCP-6500-SWORD sputtering out.>//

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

Chief Ibanez, Pilar and Leandro reached Puerto Extirpado at approximately midnight, after an uneventful trek through the bog, forest, and hills. Chief Ibanez radioed ahead; a party met them where the gully opened on the rear of the abandoned Ibanez shack.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
//<Transcript begins.>//

//<Drs. Astrauskas, McDoctorate and Okorie, Ursula and Saray are waiting at the shack when Chief Ibanez emerges. She steps aside to let Leandro pass; he moves tentatively into the village proper, and is immediately pounced upon by his younger daughter.>//

**Leandro:** Little fish.

//<He kneels to embrace her, and they remain that way in silence while the others speak.>//

//<Pilar hugs her mother.>//

**Pilar:** Told you we'd be fine.

//<Ursula draws back, and brushes a few specks of muck from Pilar's face and hair.>//

**Ursula:** You don't look fine.

**Chief Ibanez:** Nothing a bath won't fix. 

//<Seeing Drs. Astrauskas and Okorie approach her, Chief Ibanez adopts a hostile posture.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I think she thinks we're going to kiss her again.

**Dr. Okorie:** Well, I was.

//<Ursula approaches Leandro, a sorrowful smile on her face. He stands -- Saray remains attached to his legs -- and allows her to embrace him as well.>//

**Leandro:** I'm sorry. 

**Ursula:** Hush. 

**Leandro:** I tried--

**Ursula:** Hush, I said. 

//<Dr. Okorie kneels to examine the damage to Chief Ibanez's uniform.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** Are you okay?

**Chief Ibanez:** Obviously.

**Dr. Okorie:** I don't mean--

**Chief Ibanez:** I need to talk to Place. Anything to report before I do? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Nothing that can't wait. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Good. 

//<She stalks off, in the general direction of Facility-34.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** Are you gonna catch one of those showers?

**Chief Ibanez:** Might be a waste of time.

//<When she has disappeared beyond the edge of the shack, Dr. Okorie turns to see Leandro staring at her. Ursula is fussing over the state of his clothing, silently.>//

**Leandro:** Hello. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Mr. Ibanez?

**Leandro:** I go by Pelaez.

**Dr. Okorie:** Is that your first name? 

**Leandro:** No, it...

//<He frowns.>//

**Leandro:** Fina never told you my...?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** She speaks. But she speaks slowly. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Some sentences take years.

**Leandro:** You're her...

//<Leandro gestures at the rings on their fingers.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** That's right. 

**Ursula:** It's good. 

//<He glances at her, uncertain.>//

**Leandro:** It's good?

**Ursula:** Yes.

//<He keeps eye contact for a moment, nods, and looks back at Drs. Astrauskas and Okorie.>//

**Leandro:** Well. Good. Pleased to meet you. 

//<He extends a hand, and each woman shakes it in turn.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** Likewise. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I think we've all got a lot to talk about. 

**Leandro:** I've told Fina everything I know.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Mmm.

//<Her eyes are narrowed.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You shouldn't feel bad she didn't tell us about you, Mr. Pelaez.

//<He gives her an inquisitive look.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Because apparently she didn't tell you about me, either. 

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

Chief Ibanez consulted briefly with Dr. McDoctorate, confirming that the state of the Trans-Liminal Propulser was no better than before. She passed on her information regarding the failed //Nigella// crop, and was in the process of workshopping a possible solution to the dilemma when Drs. Astrauskas and Okorie joined them in the control room.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
//<Transcript begins.>//

//<Both Dr. Astrauskas and Dr. Okorie are carrying data tablets filled with the information they have gleaned both from and about the locals during Chief Ibanez's absence.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** You've got good news.

**Dr. Okorie:** How can you tell?

**Chief Ibanez:** That wasn't speculation. That was an order.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Well, I don't know if this counts as //good,// particularly, but it's interesting at least. I think the severing really is what they say it is. There's Hume tendrils waving off every one of the Extirpadans, stopping just short of each other, shearing every which way. You've got them too, and they've been reaching out ever since we arrived. I noticed it as soon as we found Pilar in the gulch. That's what I was going to tell you at the town hall.

//<She waves in the air, tracing lines only she can see. Chief Ibanez follows the trail of her fingertips, looking uneasy.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** They've also all got the same declension you have.

**Chief Ibanez:** And what do you think that means? 

**Dr. Okorie:** Could it just be because they're from Aph? Originally?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** No. The Aphians have a slight Hume //elevation.// This is on the other side of baseline.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I have an idea. 

**Chief Ibanez:** About how we can get out of here? 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I'm still working on that. Did you think I'd forgotten? 

**Chief Ibanez:** You're a mad scientist. It was at least worth considering. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Mad science is just something you perform. It's not an identity. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Have you met Everett Mann?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** The point is, I'm not comfortable talking about that subject on the record.

**Dr. Okorie:** Why?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I'm not comfortable explaining why on the record, either.

//<Chief Ibanez kicks the base of the nearest console, and the metal vibrates loudly. They all turn to face her.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** We're learning a lot about everyone's comfort zones. That's great. Now finish explaining the stupid Hume thing. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Personally, I think it's a consequence of dimensional travel. Not an indicator of origin, but repeated transportation. 

**Chief Ibanez:** How would that work?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Do you know how the transporters on //Star Trek// function?

//<Dr. Astrauskas winces.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** If that's the explanation, don't explain it.

**Chief Ibanez:** What? What's he talking about?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Never you mind. But that would certainly explain the discrepancies. Not that we could have known it before we figured out what the machine does.

**Chief Ibanez:** I think that's why the TAD fucked with my old file, too. They didn't want anyone realizing this place existed outside of time. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Probably they would have wanted something like that for themselves. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** They have something like that for themselves. 

//<The others turn to look at him.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** You ever been debriefed by them? Don't recommend it. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You remember everything now, right?

**Chief Ibanez:** Now, in this moment, in this room, yes.

**Dr. Okorie:** I still don't understand why your memories were location-specific. Has anyone been forgetting what they've learned in Puerto Extirpado?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** No, because I properly fixed those exchangers.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** What did they exchange?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Psychic fields. Those first dimensional travellers all died because the systems didn't properly sort their memory sets between worlds. Every one of their possible selves tried to template on the same brains, and fried them. The caretakers must have understood the machinery just well enough to jury-rig a stopgap system that compartmentalized you between each reality. Me, I like to work from first principles.

**Chief Ibanez:** Why didn't it do that to the Prophets? The diary says they all lived, only the Institute people kicked off.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Best guess? The Prophets don't have alternate selves.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I don't know why, but I don't like the sound of that.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I do know why. You're happier not knowing.

**Chief Ibanez:** Getting a bit tired of hearing that.

**Dr. Okorie:** So, okay. Memories compartmentalized to each universe, before, but not anymore? Meaning if we went back to all the other places Del visited...

**Dr. McDoctorate:** ...she'd get to keep her memories once she reclaimed them, yes.

**Chief Ibanez:** Pass.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Let's get back to the memories at hand. The journal entries are undated. How long were you in here for, really? Well, not really. Subjectively.

**Chief Ibanez:** Maybe two years. 

**Dr. Okorie:** What?! 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I thought it was months at the outside. Jesus Christ.

**Chief Ibanez:** Think about it. When I came in, I was an angry teenager on a lucky streak. I came out in military power armour with the mental and physical capability to use it. I came out with enough engineering knowledge for a Foundation degree. Muscle mass you'd usually need steroids to get. This place gave me all the time I needed to make myself into something new. 

//<She sighs.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** And last week, when I stepped outside again for the first time, I remembered green hell too. Not just what was in the journals, all of it. It was different when I first visited; wilder, more dangerous, no village. That's where I taught myself how to use the suit. 

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Just popping around the corner and back a few times shouldn't have been enough to affect your Hume spirals so dramatically. 

**Chief Ibanez:** It wasn't. I went to lots of other places. More than I wrote about. I wasn't a big writer. And like I said, emptied out the hydroponics.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You went on a multidimensional training voyage.

**Chief Ibanez:** Yeah.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Like--

**Chief Ibanez:** Like some batshit version of Batman. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Sheesh.

**Chief Ibanez:** Aphora will be jealous. 

//<Dr. Astrauskas is nodding.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Yeah, that's it. That's what I saw. 

**Dr. Okorie:** How can you tell?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Because now that I know to look, I can see that all of our Hume spirals are slightly off too. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** By how much? 

//<She indicates with her forefinger and thumb.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Tiny little fraction. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Compared to Del's? 

//<She squints.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Hard to say. I've got a point scale, but it's more subjective than anything. Maybe a tenth? Maybe a twentieth. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Holy shit. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** And here I thought we all took our first multidimensional trip together.

**Chief Ibanez:** Well, don't feel bad. We've probably taken our last one together.

**Dr. Okorie:** What's that mean?

**Chief Ibanez:** Egghead says our flowers won't work on this side. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Kept that to yourself, did you? 

**Chief Ibanez:** I'm the commander. That's my job. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Well, you should have shared the job. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Why? 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Because the villagers were talking about this already, obviously. They said they couldn't get the mechanism to work either, so they were really surprised when you pulled the Facility back to baseline. They thought somebody had figured out how to use it again, and abandoned them.

**Chief Ibanez:** Somebody. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Yes. Your father. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Figures. But that's not really useful information, is it? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** It is if I'm reading the implications correctly. I think your father knows something the rest of them don't. And if I'm right, we might be able to get out of here after all.

**Chief Ibanez:** Well, spill the beans. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** First I need to see if I can get the beans to spill. 

**Chief Ibanez:** What the hell does that mean? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I get to have secrets too. This is an equitable relationship we're in.

[[=]]
@@ @@
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/the-b-b-decommission/Asterisk43.png]]
@@ @@
[[/=]]

//<Dr. Okorie and Chief Ibanez emerge from the Facility together.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** What were you talking to Place about before we came in?

**Chief Ibanez:** Stranger-in-the-Mist needs leyline proximity to grow, is that right?

//<Dr. Okorie nods.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** That's what the demonics were for, in the hydroponics, you figure?

//<Dr. Okorie nods again.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Are there any leylines //here?// In this world?

**Dr. Okorie:** There are not. Not for hundreds of miles in every direction.

**Chief Ibanez:** How do you know?

**Dr. Okorie:** I set up a skein under the ground, put out feelers as far as I could go without using myself. Roz read my aura while I was doing it. New thing we figured out, I did send you the paper a few months back.

**Chief Ibanez:** Well, you knew what that would get you.

**Dr. Okorie:** Hope springs eternal.

**Chief Ibanez:** So everyone keeps telling me.

**Dr. Okorie:** You're wondering if it's possible to grow the plants here? 

**Chief Ibanez:** No, just musing. Can a leyline be alive?

//<Dr. Okorie blinks.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** Leylines are magical conduits in the earth. The demonics are a dirty hack that probably works really badly at best, and Tartareans aren't alive //per se.// So, debatable. But I think you mean 'ambulatory', which is just insane.

**Chief Ibanez:** Mad, even.

**Dr. Okorie:** Sure?

//<Chief Ibanez nods, then heads down the path.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** What prompted that?

**Chief Ibanez:** Just settling a bet. Nothing to worry about.

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

The following morning, Dr. Astrauskas scheduled a private meeting with Leandro Pelaez. He met her in the empty Ibanez shack.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
//<Transcript begins.>//

//<Dr. Astrauskas is seated in a battered steel chair. She has set up another for Leandro; he takes it, eyeing her suspiciously. She has no devices on her person, save for her lapel camera, and her hands are folded neatly in her lap.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Mr. Pelaez. We haven't been properly introduced. My name is RozÃ¡lie Astrauskas. I'm married to your daughter. 

**Leandro:** I'm still waiting for someone to explain that to me.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** There will be plenty of time for that later. 

//<When he replies, his tone is petulant.>//

**Leandro:** We have plenty of time right now. It's not like we can go anywhere. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I think you know that's not precisely true. 

//<He frowns.>//

**Leandro:** Meaning?

//<She leans forward, crossing her knees and placing both hands on them.>// 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** How would you describe the problem with the mechanism in the Facility? 

**Leandro:** Trying to catch me out? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Trying to see if we can all get on the same page. Indulge me? 

**Leandro:** We ran out of flowers, and all the ones I tried to grow here are dead.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I believe the second part of that statement is true, if a little misleading.

**Leandro:** You're calling me a liar? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Yes.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Do you want to explain, or should I? Probably you'll want me to do it, in case we're not both thinking the same thing.

//<Leandro shrugs.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Fine with me. The mechanism doesn't just need flowers, it needs flowers from the dimension you're trying to leave. 

//<Leandro's mouth twitches.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You don't really need to confirm. Dr. McDoctorate and I have it pretty well figured out.

**Leandro:** Dr. //who?//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** He'd be so pleased to hear you call him that. 

//<He waves dismissively at her, and turns to look out the open window. Chief Ibanez is using SCP-6500-SWORD to sharpen a farmer's plough in front of the blacksmith's shop, which has been converted out of the empty Lobo household shack. The blacksmith is watching, bemused. Saray is also watching; she is jumping up and down and swinging a stick while speaking with great excitement. Chief Ibanez is nodding indulgently.>//

//<Leandro scowls.>//

**Leandro:** I don't know what you're talking about. All of this is nonsense. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You were the one responsible for replanting Stranger-in-the-Mist, right? 

**Leandro:** Yes. That's one of my duties. The most important one. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** How come you were suddenly so bad at it? 

//<His head snaps back in her direction, and his tone becomes defensive.>//

**Leandro:** There was nothing sudden about it. The old crop was dead, and the knowledge of how to grow a new one was never properly passed down to me. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** That's a good explanation. But the fact you've been dishonest with me about part of this process suggests--

//<Leandro stands, and towers over her.>//

**Leandro:** Suggests what? Why don't you just come out and say it?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Okay. 

//<She looks up at him, unflinching.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You killed your own crop. 

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** They grew just fine, so you killed them yourself.

**Leandro:** Why would I do that? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Because you saw the Facility vanish when Del called it back home, and you knew what that meant, and you didn't want to leave. 

//<He walks past her, into the back room. His voice carries easily in the steel shack.>//

**Leandro:** Of course I want to leave. I've wanted to leave since the moment we got here. 

//<Dr. Astrauskas does not turn to watch him, but continues facing forward and speaking in an even tone.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Fine, you do //want// to leave. But you wouldn't let yourself do it. You were too afraid. So you stranded everyone here. 

**Leandro:** What are you basing that on? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You never let Del or her sister or her brothers leave the village. I imagine the shield was a part of that, no? Made her dizzy when she climbed too high.

**Leandro:** They don't still have vertigo back on Earth?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** All your precautions, and still you couldn't protect them. So the second time around, you found a way to control the remaining variables. 

**Leandro:** That's...

//<Leandro has walked back into the main room. Across from Dr. Astrauskas, the front door is now open. Ursula is standing in the doorway.>//

**Leandro:** Ursula. 

**Ursula:** Leandro.

**Leandro:** You heard?

**Ursula:** I heard.

**Leandro:** Do you believe this? 

**Ursula:** Of course I believe it. I've known the entire time. 

//<Silence on recording.>//

//<Leandro sags.>//

**Leandro:** Do we need to tell them? 

//<Ursula walks into the shack, and attempts to comfort her husband.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** It's true, then? 

//<Leandro spits on the floor, then looks mortified at having done so. He scuffs it out with his boot heel.>//

**Leandro:** Of course it's true. This place might not look like much to you, but to me it's the only safe home I've ever had. Killing those flowers was the easiest thing I've ever had to do. 

//<Ursula embraces him.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Was it easy killing any chance of ever seeing me again? Killing the hope in your heart?

//<She is standing at the window, which is partially ajar. Due to the buildup of soil and plant matter outside the shack, she is able to meet her father's eyes without craning her neck.>//

**Leandro:** I thought you were dead. 

**Chief Ibanez:** No, you didn't. 

//<She glances back over her shoulder, ensuring that Saray is still chatting with the blacksmith, who is inspecting the sharpened plow with an expression of astonishment. She then leans on the sill, and continues to speak.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** I'm an investigator. No reason you should have known that. It's not like we've really talked yet. But the first day in this village, after speaking with your daughters, I went looking for something. Found it in your old laundry. 

//<Chief Ibanez unslings her backpack and unzips it. She removes a faded salmon dress, and drapes it over the windowsill before placing the bag on the ground beside her.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** I left this here on the last day. I went for a swim in that bay--

//<She points.>//

**Chief Ibanez:**  --and when I came back out, I started putting on the armour. Fired up the mechanism, and went back home to Zevala. Left the last thing that connected me to you, here. 

//<She stamps her foot for emphasis.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Did you find it, or someone else? 

**Leandro:** I found it. 

//<Leandro is whispering now.>//

**Leandro:** I was the first one out. I'm always the first one out.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Another of your duties. 

**Leandro:** If something's going to happen to one of us, it should happen to me. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Why?

//<He looks up, and straightens somewhat. Ursula withdraws.>//

**Leandro:** Because you're right. It's always my fault. I wouldn't let them put the plan in motion. I wouldn't let them reach out for help. And I poured gasoline all over the flower crop. 

**Ursula:** Leo...

**Leandro:** I'm sorry, Ursula. 

**Chief Ibanez:** "The ashes of our last hope," you said.

**Leandro:** You knew.

**Chief Ibanez:** I've beaten the truth out of folks with a literally magical way with words. You're nothing by comparison.

//<Ursula winces, but takes Leandro's hand.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I don't understand. You had the flowers, and you had the dress. You had to know there was a chance she was still alive out there. 

**Chief Ibanez:** What are you talking about? Those flowers take ages to grow. Didn't he tell you the old ones had all died?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** He did tell me that.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Mr. Pelaez? 

//<He is shaking his head. He can't seem to stop.>//

**Leandro:** I never took any chances, and even so, my children... my //children...//

//<He raises his hands in a pleading gesture.>//

**Leandro:** How could you expect me to go back? 

**Chief Ibanez:** What's going on? The old flowers //were// already dead, right?

//<Silence on recording.>//

//<Chief Ibanez is ashen.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Oh, my god.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You burned them too. In 1994, when you first arrived.

//<Wordlessly, he nods. Once.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** How could you abandon your children? 

**Ursula:** Because I forced him to. 

//<Chief Ibanez stares at her.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** What? 

**Leandro:** Ursula, no--

**Ursula:** When we first arrived, I went with him. It was against the rules, but after what we saw... the rules didn't seem to matter so much anymore.

//<Leandro clutches her hand tightly.>//

**Ursula:** I picked a flower, I ground it up, and while he was tending to the rest of the crop, I had a vision. 

**Chief Ibanez:** A vision of what? Of what would happen if you tried to come back for me? 

**Ursula:** Of whether or not we //would// try. 

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** And what did you see? 

//<She makes eye contact. Both women hold it for a time.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Obviously that you wouldn't. 

**Ursula:** That's right. 

**Chief Ibanez:** So you set that in stone. You made it so you could never come home, not without damaging reality further. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You were making it easier for him. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Letting him let me go. 

**Leandro:** I'm so sorry, Fina. 

//<He pulls himself together yet again.>//

**Leandro:** But you're all safe here now. Long after everything else is perished, we'll still be here. 

//<Chief Ibanez picks up the sack again.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Nothing else is going to perish. We're going to make sure of that, soon as we get back. 

**Leandro:** Your friend is right. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Wife. 

**Leandro:** Your //wife// is right. The flowers need to be from here, and they don't grow anymore. I used the last of the seeds, and the plants are all dead. It would take decades to replace them.

**Chief Ibanez:** Pack some supplies, and meet me at the gulch tomorrow morning.

**Leandro:** Why?

**Chief Ibanez:** You're going to show me. 

**Leandro:** But... 

//<He sighs in desperate frustration.>//

**Leandro:** They're dead, I told you. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Never stopped me before.

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

As requested, before heading back out Chief Ibanez engaged in a brief consultation with Dr. McDoctorate. The latter was adamant that no record of their conversation be made.

Chief Ibanez and Leandro Pelaez left Puerto Extirpado again the following day, at first light. They travelled together to the altered treeline, at which point Chief Ibanez again left her escort on the shore before walking into the bog, SCP-6500-SWORD in hand.

The pair returned to the village at sunset.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
//<Transcript begins.>//

//<Dr. Okorie exits the Ibanez shack, stretching her back and grunting. It is late evening, and the invisible sun is setting; Puerto Extirpado is bathed in a fierce greenish-yellow glow, and verdant spores begin to catch the light all around her. They are much thicker than usual, settling over the rolling plateau like a blanket. She yawns, and takes a single step in the direction of the gully when a small stone skitters across her path, followed by a filthy brown boot, followed by its owner.>//

//<Chief Ibanez appears around the corner of the shack. Her jumpsuit hangs at her waist, and her armour is deeply scored and plastered with dried green mud. The entire right sleeve, most of the left, and both cuffs are missing. Her hair is alternately slick and matted with more mud which gleams dully in the dying light, or dripping with rotted mulch; even more mud covers every exposed inch of her body and attire, and she leaves a trail of it on the grass behind her. Two bands of rebar encircle her exposed abdomen, presumably bearing the weight of SCP-6500-SWORD which hangs behind her, glowing warmly, sheathe and harness apparently discarded. It is difficult to tell beneath the grime, but she appears physically unharmed.>//

//<Slowly, theatrically, she flexes the muscles of her right arm.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** What the fuck happened? 

//<Chief Ibanez jerks a thumb at herself.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** What did you happen to? 

//<Chief Ibanez grins.>//

[[include component:image-block
    name=http://scp-sandbox-3.wdfiles.com/local--files/harry-blank-8/FWP.jpg|
    caption=Chief Ibanez returns. |
    width=700px|
    align=center|
]]

**Chief Ibanez:** Wholeass dragon.

//<She claws hair out of her face, and wipes the sweat from her brow.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** This time it //took.//

**Dr. Okorie:** Fina, Warrior Princess.

//<Both laugh.>//

//<Dr. Astrauskas exits the shack, turns, and freezes when she sees Chief Ibanez.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** What the hell happened? 

//<Chief Ibanez and Dr. Okorie laugh again.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Where's your father? 

**Chief Ibanez:** Dragging the sack. 

**Dr. Okorie:** What sack?

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

Leandro Pelaez arrived at Facility-34 half an hour later with Chief Ibanez's bag in tow, filled to the brim with //N. cerritulus// revitalized via the anomalous properties of a hyper-energized SCP-6500-SWORD. Dr. McDoctorate performed his baseline tests a second time, and indicated that the TLP's 'pilot light' was now back on. It was possible to return to baseline reality.

The villagers of Puerto Extirpado were informed that a transference would take place the following day, and they should prepare their structures and remove all vital personal possessions to the Facility. A feast was held in the town square using the remainder of their perishable goods, after which Delta-6500 met with the Ibanez/Pelaez family for a final debriefing.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
//<Transcript begins.>//

//<It is late. Chief Ibanez and Leandro have showered and changed into fresh clothing, and the adults are drinking homemade malt beer from malformed green glass bottles around the kitchen table, except for Pilar who is lying on the floor, sound asleep and snoring.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** All's well that ends well.

**Ursula:** Have you ever heard of tempting fate, Dr. Place?

//<He laughs.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Don't get me started.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** He means that. Don't.

**Dr. Okorie:** You look pretty gutted, Mr. Pelaez.

**Leandro:** Just call me Leandro, please.

**Dr. Okorie:** Leandro. I know you've got misgivings--

//<A tear rolls down his cheek. He doesn't bother to brush it away.>//

**Leandro:** It's not even that.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Then what?

**Leandro:** I just saw my daughter do something I never thought possible. It still seems impossible. It was already impossible to even see her again.

//<Dr. Okorie reaches out to hold his hand. He is surprised, but allows the contact.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** She does that a lot. You won't get used to it, but you will get used to expecting it.

//<He shakes his head.>//

**Leandro:** I never imagined anything like that could be under the ground. I didn't even believe Saray when she told me about her birds. 

**Dr. Okorie:** They might not have existed until recently.

//<He frowns.>//

**Leandro:** How's that?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** This world is waking up. 

**Leandro:** What does that mean? 

**Chief Ibanez:** Nothing good for ours.

//<He appears to give up attempting to understand, and sighs deeply.>//

**Leandro:** I never wanted any of this for you, Fina.

//<She shrugs.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** It's not your problem anymore. It's mine. So you can either help me fix it, or stay out of my way.

//<He nods.>//

**Leandro:** I don't know what help I can be, but you...

//<He smiles tentatively.>//

**Leandro:** You are a //wonder.// Now and always. You only need to ask.

//<Dr. Astrauskas tugs at Chief Ibanez's cheek. The latter scowls, but does not resist.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Our miracle worker.

//<Leandro swirls his bottle, staring at the liquid through the distortion of the glass, then takes a deep breath as though he is building up his courage.>//

**Leandro:** How did the three of you meet? 

**Dr. Okorie:** Roz was in my cohort as a novice thaumaturge. Del was Chief of Security where we worked. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Then lots of people died, and here we are.

//<Leandro blinks.>//

**Ursula:** Our people have married outside the village often, of course. And our ancestors did the same.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Can't sustain a population that low without exogamy. Not healthily, at least.

**Ursula:** My point is, you're not the only one to leave home to find love. 

**Chief Ibanez:** I never left home. Home left me.

//<She empties her bottle, and claps it to the table with finality.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Leandro. You offered, now I'm asking. No more secrets. 

**Ursula:** I think that's for the best. 

**Chief Ibanez:** What was the Chaos Insurgency doing in Zevala?

//<Leandro stands, and leaves the room for a moment to check on where Saray is sleeping. When he returns, he shuts the door behind him before sitting down again and looking under the table at Pilar. She is still snoring.>//

**Leandro:** They were building something. 

**Chief Ibanez:** I know that. What were they building? 

**Ursula:** We never heard. We never even asked. They shot anyone who said anything they didn't like. 

**Leandro:** Your mother...

//<Chief Ibanez raises a hand, a look of warning in her eyes.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** I know more about that than you do. But come on. You were all cooped up in their cages for weeks. You must have learned something. 

**Leandro:** Why is that important? It was so long ago. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Because the Insurgency is toast, but the kind of shit they were into? It lingers. We don't understand why they were so focused on Zevala, and we don't know how they're connected to the rest of what's going on, and we can't very well ask them. 

**Leandro:** Didn't you take any prisoners?

**Chief Ibanez:** Me? 

//<She scoffs.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** No.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** And trust me, they had an even bigger taste for cyanide than they had for blue flowers. 

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Ursula:** I really do not know, Delfina. 

**Leandro:** I do. 

**Ursula:** What? 

**Leandro:** They kept me separate from the others. Made me do things. Tell them things.

//<He shakes his head at the implied question in his wife's eyes.>//

**Leandro:** I'm not going to expand on that. It wouldn't do anybody any good to know. What matters is we're all still alive because of it. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Not all of us. Those people you sold us out to--

**Leandro:** I didn't sell anyone out. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Then who did? How did they find us, d--...?

//<She picks up the bottle again, and swills the last few drops. He waits a moment for her to finish, and resume speaking; when she does not, he does.>//

**Leandro:** Mostly what they wanted was information. A lot of it was about the Facility. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Like what? 

**Leandro:** What it did. How it worked. I played dumb, gave them little tidbits here and there like I was only just now putting the pieces together. Stalling until I saw my chance to get away. To get everyone away. 

**Chief Ibanez:** And you heard things?

**Leandro:** Heard, and saw. They were building something in one of the crevasses. Something big and shiny. And it was taking something out of the air. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Taking what? 

**Leandro:** I don't know. They called it a Hume collector. It was on for weeks, and it chugged through an ungodly amount of fuel. Smoked like a bastard. I think it was draining all the life out of the bay. You remember the sunsets? 

//<Chief Ibanez nods.>//

**Leandro:** They were never the same after that thing was turned on. 

**Ursula:** And the flowers. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Stranger-in-the-Mist? 

**Ursula:** They dredged up the entire cargo from the //Northern Reach.// I know that much.

**Leandro:** And they fed it all in.

//<Dr. McDoctorate suddenly drums the table in triumph. Beneath, Pilar stirs but does not wake.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I knew it! I //knew// it.

//<Dr. Astrauskas leans over, and they share a high-five.>//

**Leandro:** What did you know?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I don't have all the right equipment for this -- it was only just invented, after all, which is why nobody ever ran the tests before -- but I was able to jury-rig some of what I found in the Facility, and it gave us a very strong--

**Chief Ibanez:** Tonight, Place.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** We know why the //Nigella// in the hydroponics worked for all universes, probably.

**Leandro:** I never figured that out myself. The man who taught me didn't know.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** It was Dr. Astrauskas who cracked it, really.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** It was half my magic and half your science. You're much too modest.

**Chief Ibanez:** He really isn't.

**Dr. Okorie:** What did you guys figure out, though?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** That these flowers grow in every dimension. They //exist// in every dimension. And I don't just mean versions of them. The same flowers. The same //instances// of the same flowers. They're entangled across the timeplane. They're a multiversal constant. The name is a misnomer; these flowers are strange to //nowhere.// 

//<The others exchange glances.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Then again, maybe //that's// what it means. Strange to nowhere. Strangers //only// in the mist, the inter-universal gulf where nothing grows but nothing.

//<He shakes himself out of his musing.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** But that's why they give visions. They're connected to every reality.

**Chief Ibanez:** The same flowers blooming under every sun.

**Ursula:** That's beautiful.

**Leandro:** And I let you wear them in your hair.

**Ursula:** That's beautiful, too.

//<He looks away. There are tears in his eyes.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** But what does that have to do with the hydroponics?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** //Nigella// grown in the Facility aren't in any universe. It's a pocket all its own. They're Hume-neutral, and can access the entire set without corrupting the data with local identifiers. That's why they let the TLP get a fix on so many coordinates, and you just have to pick one and see where it goes.

**Dr. Okorie:** Maybe that's what the time dilation was for, too. Maybe it was intentional.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Hmm?

**Dr. Okorie:** So the Facility could regrow its crop without taking up thirty years real-time.

//<His eyes widen.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I really do love how smart we all are. You know that?

**Leandro:** I don't think I will ever understand how people like you exist.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Thank you!

//<Dr. Okorie nudges Dr. McDoctorate.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** What was your secret little chat with Del about? Before she went out to kill the dragon?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Isn't it obvious? He told her to kill the dragon so the sword could power up and bring the plants back to life.

**Chief Ibanez:** That was my idea. He said it wouldn't work.

**Dr. Okorie:** But... it //did// work.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Powering up the sword was only half of it. Leandro wasn't lying when he said the plants didn't grow well here. That's because their leyline wasn't reliable.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** There //is// no leyline. We established that.

**Dr. Okorie:** But then they could never have grown at all. Wait a fucking second.

//<Chief Ibanez snorts.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Do you get it?

**Dr. Okorie:** No way.

**Chief Ibanez:** //Do you get it?//

**Leandro:** What?

**Dr. Okorie:** Ambulatory leylines.

**Leandro:** What?

**Dr. Okorie:** The dragon?

**Chief Ibanez:** The dragon.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I do wish I could have seen it. 

//<Leandro grimaces.>//

**Leandro:** You can have my memories.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Not in my skillset. That's Udo's territory.

**Leandro:** Huh?

**Dr. Okorie:** It's a shame none of the camera footage is clear.

**Chief Ibanez:** I'll make sure to bring a Steadicam next time. 

**Ursula:** Well, Pilar drew this.

//<She places a sketch on the table.>//

[[include component:image-block
    name=http://scp-sandbox-3.wdfiles.com/local--files/harry-blank-8/Dino--Drew.jpg|
    caption= Extranormal Entity, rendering by SCP-8273-2. |
    width=700px|
    align=center|
]]

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Oh. //Wow.//

**Dr. Okorie:** You fought //that?//

//<Chief Ibanez glances over the sketch. She whistles appreciatively.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** More or less. Looked a little different close-up, and I think there were more wings. Fatter mouth? Might just have been my... forced perspective.

**Leandro:** Pilar drew this? It's beautiful.

**Ursula:** You should see the wood carvings Saray has been working on.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Ursula:** You really should have just come back home, you silly man. 

//<Leandro flushes, and turns to Chief Ibanez.>//

**Leandro:** What artistic talents have you picked up? Since this is apparently a family of prodigies.

**Chief Ibanez:** Harpsichord. I got into the Royal Academy, but had to defer for a semester so I could see the worlds.

**Ursula:** If I might interrupt. Your plan was to kill the dragon, Delfina. His plan was //also// to kill the dragon. Why did he say your plan wouldn't work?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Her plan was to kill it for the wrong reason. Intentionality matters--

**Drs. Astrauskas and Okorie:** [simultaneously] --when it comes to magic.

**Leandro:** This is //insanity.//

**Chief Ibanez:** Why did you think I lured it to the plantation before killing it?

//<Leandro purses his lips.>//

**Leandro:** Honestly?

//<She nods.>//

**Leandro:** I thought you wanted to frighten me.

//<All laugh.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** It does mean we really do have to be moving on, though.

**Ursula:** Why?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Because that thing was more than just a living leyline. I got the data from the atmospheric collectors we set up around the ridge, and compared it to the dragon guts on Delfina's ruined clothing, and--

**Chief Ibanez:** You went through my laundry?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Woman, I was //doing// your laundry.

//<All laugh.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** The dragon was algal. It was a spore-creature. The same spores we see in the sky every morning and every night.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** By the same, you mean--

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I mean the air we breath is dragon's breath. Yes.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** I //thought// they were getting pretty thick, these last couple days.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** You slew this world's primordial deity, Chief. Or one of them. No matter what else happens next, nothing will be the same. Your coming marked the end of this world's mythical age. The advent of heroes.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Mother of the future.

**Dr. Okorie:** Prometheus with a sword.

//<Chief Ibanez looks up at the ceiling, reflectively.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I didn't mean to harsh your buzz with an inconvenient truth.

//<She shoots him a dirty look.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** I can't think of anything to say about that.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Segue!

**Chief Ibanez:** Segue! What were we... right. The machine. The other one. The one the Insurgency was making. What did it //do?//

**Leandro:** Calculations, I heard. Lots and lots of calculations. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Calculations they could only do in Zevala. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Or with something unique to its environment. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Particles in the air. The stuff I was detecting.

**Chief Ibanez:** The festivals.

**Ursula:** What? 

**Chief Ibanez:** What were the festivals? What were they really? 

//<Ursula and Leandro exchange a glance.>//

**Ursula:** We took the village... 

**Leandro:** Elsewhere. 

**Chief Ibanez:** I saw the sky change.

**Leandro:** Of course you did. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Why? Why do that? 

**Ursula:** It's what we've always done. The Prophets started it. 

**Leandro:** It helped protect us. Replenished our defences. Put something in the air that fed the machine that strengthened the dome. 

**Chief Ibanez:** You'd stopped doing it by the time I was a teenager.

**Leandro:** The machine was too far gone by then, and we didn't know how to repair it.

**Ursula:** That's not entirely true. We didn't exactly lose sleep over the decision. We already thought it was too dangerous. 

**Leandro:** We thought the defences were strong enough already.

**Ursula:** We thought it would bring unwanted attention. 

**Chief Ibanez:** The Insurgency? 

**Leandro:** The Foundation.

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** But that's what let them in, isn't it? 

**Leandro:** Maybe. Probably. If you ask me, Dom Magnusson sold us out.

**Dr. Okorie:** Who?

**Chief Ibanez:** Captain of the //Northern Reach.// If he was in on it, he sure got paid for his trouble.

**Dr. Okorie:** Is this why the dome hardened before it fell? Why nothing could go in or out? Was that a symptom of it failing, because you didn't keep it fuelled up?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** That's one possibility. It might also have been reacting to the firefight in the sky, closing up shop to protect everyone.

**Chief Ibanez:** Worked great, didn't it.

**Ursula:** What does it matter? What does one more thing that went wrong matter in the long litany? Can't you just let these things go? 

**Leandro:** She's right to question us. We kept so much from them all.

**Chief Ibanez:** All I care about is seeing this thing through. If the Insurgency was building a machine that ran on the emissions of the Facility, or the air in the alternate dimensions...

//<Her eyes suddenly widen, and her mouth snaps shut.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** No.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Alternate dimensions. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Multiversal data sets.

**Dr. Okorie:** The flowers. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** The aura variations. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Fuel. //Churning.//

**Dr. Okorie:** Calculations. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Probability.

**Dr. Okorie:** //No.//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Are we saying...

**Dr. McDoctorate:** It's the only logical explanation. And the timeline works.

//<Drs. Astrauskas, McDoctorate and Okorie each look as though they wish to speak next, but something is holding them back.>//

//<Chief Ibanez makes eye contact with all three in turn, then finally nods.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** That's it, then.

//<They nod back, one by one.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** It's the Engine. They were building the Engine. 

//<Leandro and Ursula are looking back and forth between the four of them.//

**Leandro:** What Engine? 

**Chief Ibanez:** Never mind. I understand now. It let them triangulate. Build up a sort of... cosmic cheat sheet. Visions of the future. Visions they could act on. Oh, Jesus.

**Dr. Okorie:** What? 

**Chief Ibanez:** This changed everything. This //changed// everything. 

//<Drs. Astrauskas, McDoctorate and Okorie are in obvious shock. None speak until Chief Ibanez prompts them again.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Zevala is the reason the Insurgency couped itself. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Reorganized around the Engine. 

**Dr. Okorie:** Change. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** //Change.//

**Chief Ibanez:** //Delta// Command. 

//<Dr. Okorie whistles.>//

**Leandro:** What does all this mean? 

**Chief Ibanez:** It means you gave the worst people in the world a road map to conquest. 

**Ursula:** Conquest of what?

**Chief Ibanez:** Everything.

**Leandro:** But you said they were destroyed. 

**Dr. McDoctorate:** The Engine predicted the future for them, but its predictions stopped being correct a couple years back. Very badly. Something else intervened, and changed the nature of causality. We're still trying to determine what.

**Chief Ibanez:** But that doesn't matter, not in this context. The Insurgency were only the hand of something bigger. Only //one// hand. And they rowed us a long, long way down the river before we cut that hand off.

**Ursula:** Is there anything we can do to fix it? 

**Chief Ibanez:** There's one thing.

//<She stands, walks to the icebox, and begins retrieving a new set of green bottles.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** It's time we brought those sunsets back to Argentina.

[[=]]
@@ @@
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/the-b-b-decommission/Asterisk43.png]]
@@ @@
[[/=]]

//<The scientists and Chief Ibanez are spending the night in the shack, room having been made by the removal of most of the family's possessions to Facility-34. As they lie on their bedrolls, still inebriated, Chief Ibanez turns to face Dr. Astrauskas.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** How did you make sense of it? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Hmm?

**Chief Ibanez:** The thing with the flowers? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Oh. 

//<Dr. Astrauskas yawns.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** You're not the only one who learned a new thing in that Facility. I tried something I've never tried before. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Don't keep me in suspense. I'll snap before I bend. 

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Engineering joke. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Engineering joke. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I read the aura of the flowers we brought with us. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Flowers have auras?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Most living things do, but not as complex when they aren't sapient. It only occurred to me to look when I saw the Leading Edge had one. I just wondered. And what I saw was the most incredible little constellation of interlocking Hume spirals you can imagine.

**Chief Ibanez:** I can't imagine that at all.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I'll draw you a pretty diagram when we get back. Suffice to say I had to go on antipsychotics after. It was... a strain.

//<Chief Ibanez reaches out and interlocks their fingers. A tear rolls down Dr. Astrauskas' cheek.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** What?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** They find each other. The flowers. Across all that empty. They stay connected. Entangled. It's...

**Chief Ibanez:** Yeah.

//<Dr. Astrauskas clears her throat.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** So after I saw that, I went back down to hydroponics, and checked out all those dead twigs. Hume spirals leave a residuum which lasts a good long while after death, but it should have run out by now. Luckily, time in here is all screwy, so. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Declension and elevation. You could see they'd been using flowers from other dimensions, and storing them alive in the hydroponics. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** I could. It was only a few out of thousands, probably just as an insurance policy. But I knew.

**Chief Ibanez:** Still a bit of a logical leap, wasn't it? I mean, presumably they were growing plants across the multiverse for practical purposes too. Not wanting to rely on the Facility's freezer. That didn't necessarily mean it was a requirement. 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** No, you're right. I did make an educated guess. 

**Chief Ibanez:** Based on what? 

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Your father seemed so guilty. I knew he couldn't be telling the truth. The way he told it, it wasn't his fault. 

//<Chief Ibanez embraces her where they lie.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Roz, there's a lot you don't know about how guilt works, and I hope you never do.

//<Dr. Okorie embraces her from behind.>//

//<Silence on recording.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Flora aura.

**Drs. Astrauskas and Okorie:** [simultaneously] Shut up.

//<Laughter.>//

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

The following morning, the sun visibly rose over Puerto Extirpado for the first time. The haze had shifted from the horizon to the hills around the village, spores wafting in on the breeze.

After a brief vigil to observe this phenomenon, the villagers were evacuated to Facility-34. Dr. McDoctorate and his technicians prepared to return the Facility to baseline reality, with Leandro providing the requisite data to include the village's standing structures in the transference. Two hours before the scheduled transit, Ursula asked a favour of Chief Ibanez.

In final preparation for the transit, the Extirpadans engaged in their unsevering ritual in the foyer of Facility-34. There is no documentation or recording testifying to the nature of this ritual, as by their request no Foundation personnel were to attend the ceremony -- save for Chief Ibanez.

She declined to offer testimony about what she saw and heard, though she did make a few brief observations in the presence of Dr. Okorie.

[[# anchor-16]]

**Addendum 8273-16, Battle of Zevala:** Chief Ibanez acquired a set of powered armour from the Facility-34 lockup, matching the set she donned during the original Operation TAILWIND KITE, before exiting the Facility with Dr. Okorie. They emerged into a battle already in progress between unidentified assailants and Foundation operatives, including the support personnel for Delta-6500 and first responders including MTFs Dseda-8 ("Desperta Ferro"), Delta-4 ("Minutemen"), Delta-45 ("Rolling Thunder"), and Sigma-9 ("Valkyries"). The battle had begun approximately one hour prior with the tracking of a large aerial force of unknown origin across the Andes Mountains and proceeding rapidly to Caleta San Roque. Immediate casualties on both sides were extremely high, with the attackers engaging in reckless, often self-destructive behaviour. The battle was complicated by the sudden reappearance of the entire village of Zevala on its former footprint, including the remains of the old Chaos Insurgency fortifications and a variety of new structures constructed in the interim; the attackers began indiscriminately firing on and bombing the Zevalan shacks as well, though they also began concentrating particular firepower on the gulch now containing Facility-34. A combination of Foundation resistance and geography prevented serious damage from being inflicted as the Facility resettled in baseline reality, though fighting continued to be fierce.

Dr. Okorie provided cover for Dr. McDoctorate to evacuate the Extirpadans from Facility-34 and secure them in the cave indicated by Chief Ibanez. She then joined the Chief at the mouth of the gulch, looking out on the beach and the bay beyond.

Pieces of melted metal and polymer fall into the bay, which is already sizzling with debris. The hulk of the// Northern Reach //groans as it resettles in the new geography, slipping deeper beneath the water; only the stern is now visible.>//

Between the gunfire, artillery, explosions, collapsing cliffs and shouting, it is almost impossible to discern plain speech.>//

//<She raises her hands high above her head, and brings SCP-6500-SWORD down with tremendous force on the cockpit glass. The pilot's eyes are visible beneath their helmet; they are wide with terror and confusion.>//

//<The canopy shatters, and Chief Ibanez falls into the plane. She slices the pilot's harness with SCP-6500-SWORD, drives it into their chest, locks her boots onto the cockpit frame and levers them out of their chair. They fall, blood gushing out in spirals and body striking the left wing before pinwheeling down to the waters of the bay.>//

//<Chief Ibanez drops herself into the chair, standing on the seat to better access the controls. Her suit's onboard systems adapt to the interface automatically, and she is able to achieve fine control of the craft's course in a matter of seconds. She veers hard to the right, and just as she is about to collide with the dead pilot's wingman, she kicks off and out of the cockpit.>//

//<She falls for several metres as the two planes violently disintegrate; on the ground, Dr. Okorie is briefly distracted by the need to create a stone portico over the mouth of the gulch to protect herself from being strafed. Chief Ibanez screams, then stops abruptly as the particles coalesce around her again and arrest her descent.>//

//<There are now dozens of craft in the air. The attackers are chipping away relentlessly at the gulch. Captain Seon is heard over Chief Ibanez's suit radio:>//

**Captain Seon:** All assets, Code Pyre on grid 7. Code Pyre, grid 7.

//<A pillar of light appears, stretching from outer space to the surface of the bay. It is five metres in diameter. One half of an Insurgent troop carrier, the other half now nonexistent, is flung down into the sizzling hole as the waters refill themselves. Human forms tumble from the doors and leap from rear bay. Several attempt low altitude parachute deployment, but their chutes burn away immediately.>//

//<Dr. McDoctorate eases an outwardly-unresponsive Dr. Okorie into his arms. As he is doing this, a heavily modified black transport helicopter swings into position, and begins firing heavy rounds from a door-mounted rotary cannon. Dseda-8 personnel return fire, forming a protective perimeter around the mouth of the gulch, but many are mowed down where they stand due to the lack of cover. Rock faces burst from the ground to protect the casualties, courtesy Dr. Okorie, and medics move in to provide first aid.>//

//<Chief Ibanez is lifted toward the helicopter.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Not the door! My armour won't-- WHAT ARE YOU--

//<Chief Ibanez braces for impact as Dr. Okorie's particles fling her at the helicopter's undercarriage. Her momentum decreases substantially as she is pressed to the metal plates, and she swings SCP-6500-SWORD -- now glowing so brightly as to artifact on the camera feed -- to carve an entrance. Rivets pop and plates melt, and the particles press Chief Ibanez up through the helicopter's internals, hacking and slashing, to emerge in the centre of the troop compartment.>//

//<Camera feed is obscured by red. Sounds of screaming and shouting barely cut the din of gunfire and explosions. The rattling of the rotary gun abruptly ceases, and Chief Ibanez's view clears. She is wiping blood from her helmet visor on a set of combat fatigues attached to a headless corpse, which she pushes out the open window. The cabin is filled with dead and dying men. She grabs the rotary gun, raises it up, and begins firing on the nearest attacking aircraft. Two planes disassemble in midair, their components raining on the roofs of Zevala, before the helicopter abruptly banks and she is nearly thrown out the still-open door.>//

//<Chief Ibanez grips the nearest stanchion hard enough to dent the metal, and flings herself toward the cockpit. She swings SCP-6500-SWORD, severing both the headrests and heads of the pilot and co-pilot. Beyond, an attacking plane is flying directly toward the helicopter, guns firing. The cabin is suddenly filled with daylight from hundreds of machine gun holes. Chief Ibanez swings SCP-6500-SWORD again, harder, and a wave of red flame sweeps out from the blade's edge, shattering the cockpit glass and billowing out into the open air. She takes cover behind the remains of the co-pilot and his chair as the plane catches up to the wave of fire -- apparently unaffected by momentum -- which is sucked into the fuselage within and jet intakes without. There is a series of explosions from the aircraft's wings, and it begins to roll precariously. Chief Ibanez leaps back, grabs a handhold, and hurls herself from the open door as the craft's interior is consumed by flame and it continues to spiral. She is caught by a sheet of sparkling red and green particles, which gently slow her descent by increasing gradually in density as she falls. Overhead, the plane careens into one of its wing mates, and both erupt into a single brilliant ball of flame.>//

//<The attackers at the mouth of the gulch disappear as a second orbital cannon shot reduces a wide stretch of beach to gleaming green glass.>//

//<Chief Ibanez continues to fall, in the vicinity of the town hall and the remains of the pier. A massive cloud of dust rises up from the rim of the Zevalan cliffs, consolidates into the shape of an enormous human hand with long, delicate fingers, and swats three approaching bombers out of the sky, a trail of white fire streaking the red horizon.>//

[[include component:image-block
    name=http://scp-sandbox-3.wdfiles.com/local--files/harry-blank-8/Battle.jpg|
    caption= The Battle of Zevala. |
    width=700px|
    align=center|
]]

//<Chief Ibanez's camera feed telescopes, revealing Dr. Okorie standing at the mouth of the gully, Foundation agents in a protective circle around her and Dr. McDoctorate still supporting her weight. She rotates her wrist, and the particle hand follows suit, thrusting up into the clouds to intercept the next flight of attackers.>//

//<Chief Ibanez whoops, and her armour registers several hits from small arms fire. She laughs as the particles deposit her on the ground, and twirls SCP-6500-SWORD while a squadron of enemy infantry take cover around her position and continue to open fire.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Can't you do math?

//<She engages the belligerents, cackling as SCP-6500-SWORD catches fire and continues to burn for the remainder of the encounter, which lasts approximately twenty-two seconds.>//

//<Spores are rising from the burning structures in the village, and the horizon subtly shifts to a more complex spectrum incorporating magenta and gold.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Confirm evacuation.

//<Dr. McDoctorate's voice comes over the radio as Chief Ibanez heads for the nearest gun emplacement, where Foundation agents have been overrun by enemy troops in a wild variety of inappropriate camouflage patterns.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Almost everyone. Udo's unconscious.

**Captain Seon:** Opposing force in disorderly rout.

//<Another voice breaks in.>//

**Voice:** Valkyrie-1 here. We show armour moving in on the ridge around the Facility. Need orbital support, our rounds can't penetrate.

**Captain Seon:** Can't fire the OWP again without risking the Masq. Two was pushing it already.

**Chief Ibanez:** And we can't lose the TLP. We //cannot// lose that machine, people. Sound off!

//<A series of quick responses indicate that no Foundation personnel are available or able to intercept the new attackers.>//

//<Chief Ibanez has reached the gun emplacement. She beheads the nearest enemy, and his corpse catches fire.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** EYES CLOSED!

//<She raises SCP-6500-SWORD, still running, and a blinding flash is emitted. The attackers fall to the ground, clutching their eyes, and the surviving Foundation agents take full advantage. Chief Ibanez is still running; the servos in her leg motors are now whining loud enough to be heard through the din.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** I need ten minutes. Buy me ten minutes!

**Captain Seon:** That's a negative, Chief, no assets in the vicinity.

**Chief Ibanez:** Somebody! Place--

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I think she'll die if I try to wake her up.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Del!

**Chief Ibanez:** What?!

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Your dad--

//<Yet another voice cuts in on the same channel.>//

**Leandro:** Tell your planes to wave off! All of them!

//<Chief Ibanez is moving up the northeastern rise, pounding divots into the earth with the force of her footfalls. She is bounding, barely touching the ground, but she is not out of breath.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** What are you doing?

**Leandro:** Did you know this place came with an instruction manual?

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Don't you fucking dare say--

**Leandro:** I burned it, with the flowers.

**Chief Ibanez:** What are you //doing?//

**Leandro:** Exercising my Directorial privilege. Are you running right now?

**Chief Ibanez:** Of course I'm fucking running!

**Leandro:** Stop.

//<She runs faster. Her HUD shows internal stress and rising heat levels as the motors struggle to keep up.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Never do.

**Leandro:** It's okay. I need you to stop running before I do this.

**Chief Ibanez:** Not on your life.

**Leandro:** Fina! STOP!

**Chief Ibanez:** NO!

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Ow! Jesus!

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Oh my god...

//<There is a sudden gust, and a wall of soil erupts in front of Chief Ibanez. She bursts through it, then another, then another, and although she does not stop running, it does slow her momentum. The dust forms into a hand, much smaller than before, and guides her to a halt against the cliff face.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** [weakly] I've got you.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Udo!

**Chief Ibanez:** What's wrong? I can't see! Roz?

**Leandro:** Is she stopped?

**Dr. Okorie:** She's stopped...

**Leandro:** Good.

//<A sudden whine fills the air, audible across the bay.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Dad...

**Leandro:** I told you, Fina.

//<The whine rises in intensity, and the final message can barely be discerned.>//

**Leandro:** This is the last trip.

//<A pillar of superheated plasma rises up from the terminus of the Facility gulch, catching a stray enemy airbus and obliterating it instantly. An electromagnetic pulse rebounds from the centre of the explosion, and all electronic devices in a wide radius immediately cease function. The attacking armour stop abruptly, at the lip of the gulch, then tumble down into the white-hot pit that has formed where Facility-34 once stood. The surrounding cliffs collapse.>//

//<Chief Ibanez's HUD flickers out.>//

//<She is weeping.>//

//<Behind her, the// Northern Reach //slides silently beneath the surface of the bay.>//

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

----

[[# anchor-17]]

**Addendum 8273-17, Aftermath:** Minutes after the destruction of Facility-34, a message was received at Foundation facilities across the globe. Taking advantage of a security vulnerability (since closed), all personnel were for a brief period able to access this message. A reproduction is appended below.

[[div class="chaos"]]
[[=]]
+ The sun is shining.

But your shadow thins on the dial, as we pass from the daylight hours. 
You turn to witness the final light, and we rise to deny you its closure.

The look on your faces!

[[=image CR.png]]

+ We are Chaos Resurgent.

No more daisies and dance steps. We bring an abyss. 

You deny us nothing: a charnel pit, and hollow men. 
He gives us everything. 

We deny you the pattern. 
He sees it still.

All prophets are used.

This sun will forget you.
The next will never know.

++ SIX. SEVEN. SEVEN.
[[div style="height: 12px"]]
[[/div]]
[[/=]]
[[/div]]

The Emergent Threat Tactical Response Authority is presently considering the implications of the above.

Chief Ibanez found her armour permanently disabled by the electromagnetic pulse attending the destruction of Facility-34. As such she quickly dismantled the suit, and made her way to the gulch and its attached cave on foot at a rapid pace. 

[[div class="blockquote"]]
//<Transcript begins.>//

//<The Extirpadans, now Zevalans again, are clustered around the back of the shallow cave. Some are being treated for minor abrasions by Foundation medics, as are a large number of Foundation agents. Emergency lights have been set up throughout, though a great deal of firelight is coming through the open mouth of the cave; beyond, Caleta San Roque is plastered from east to west with the flaming debris of dozens of aircraft and littered with uncountable corpses.>//

//<Chief Ibanez appears, puffing, having run at a constant rate of speed across nearly half the length of the plateau.>//

//<Dr. Astrauskas waves from the eastern end.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Del!

//<Chief Ibanez approaches, still at a run. Her eyes are wild, and she is covered in a thick sheen of sweat. She skids to a stop, nearly slipping on the slick stone, and takes a knee in front of Dr. Astrauskas.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Oh my god.

//<She weeps as she falls on the prone figure of Leandro Ibanez, who is breathing shallowly and coughing. Beside him, Dr. Okorie is propped up on her elbows, grinning; Ursula, Pilar, and Saray are sitting on the cave floor by his head, also grinning.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Oh my god.

//<Leandro's eyes open, and he looks up at his daughter.>//

**Leandro:** Guess it worked.

//<Chief Ibanez presses her head to his chest, and wraps her arms around him tightly. He holds his hands out, hesitating; Ursula reaches down and places them on Chief Ibanez's back. He holds her tight, and closes his eyes.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Asshole.

**Leandro:** What?

//<She pulls him even closer.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Fucking //asshole.// I thought you blew yourself up.

**Leandro:** I thought so too.

//<Dr. Okorie places a hand on Chief Ibanez's shoulder. Chief Ibanez reaches up to entwine their fingers.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** [muffled] You getting electrolytes?

**Leandro:** I'm f--

**Dr. Okorie:** She means me.

//<Dr. Astrauskas pokes Dr. Okorie, who grimaces.>//

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Your wife shocked her own heart.

//<Chief Ibanez looks up.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** What?

**Dr. Astrauskas:** Her consciousness was still in the particles when she passed out. She defibrillated herself. Gave Place a nasty zap, too. 

//<Chief Ibanez glares at both of them. Dr. Okorie laughs, hoarsely.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** Well, it worked. You're welcome for saving your dad, and stopping you from pancaking in your armour when the EMP hit.

**Chief Ibanez:** Get over here.

//<Dr. Okorie scoots closer, and embraces Chief Ibanez over Leandro. Dr. Astrauskas follows suit. After a moment, Saray joins them.>//

//<Chief Ibanez reaches up to ruffle her youngest sister's hair.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Little punk.

**Saray:** What does that even mean?

//<Pilar puts a hand on Saray's shoulder.>//

**Pilar:** It's a compliment.

//<Saray kisses Chief Ibanez on the cheek. The latter's eyes widen in surprise.>//

**Saray:** You're a punk too, Fina.

//<Ursula laughs.>//

//<One by one, they withdraw to sit in a rough circle around Leandro's prone form. He sits up; Dr. McDoctorate arrives, and kicks a pillow under the other man's head.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Well, that's another scientific miracle blown to hell.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** There'll always be more.

**Dr. McDoctorate:** Right, because I'm going to build them.

//<He sits down between Dr. Astrauskas and Pilar.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** I'll design mine not to blow up.

//<Chief Ibanez takes her father's hand.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** You did that so they couldn't have it.

//<Leandro nods.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Even though it traps you here.

**Leandro:** Don't read too much into it. If they'd stolen the thing, we'd still be trapped here.

**Chief Ibanez:** Still, it was a nice gesture.

//<She winces.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** Even if it might have totally fucked us all.

**Leandro:** What?

**Chief Ibanez:** The vision. Without the Facility...

**Leandro:** What vision?

//<Ursula gently brushes his sweat-matted hair from his forehead.>//

**Ursula:** The future can wait another day. I have a more pressing concern. Who attacked us?

//<Dr. McDoctorate adopts a grim expression.>//

**Dr. McDoctorate:** It's who you think, more or less.

//<He takes a tablet out of his labcoat, and turns it so Chief Ibanez can see.>//

//<She glances at the message, and grunts.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** At least they're keeping to the theme, this time around.

**Dr. Astrauskas:** What do you think it means?

//<Dr. Okorie considers.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** Maybe they've decided they really do like chaos, after all.

**Chief Ibanez:** It's a lot worse than that.

//<All eyes turn to her.>//

**Chief Ibanez:** It means they've decided that chaos is going to win.

//<Pilar looks away. Ursula looks at the cave ceiling.>//

//<Leandro squeezes Chief Ibanez's hand, and she looks down at him again.>//

**Leandro:** I'll bet you've got something to say about that.

//<Chief Ibanez smiles at him. She releases his hand -- he is slow to reciprocate -- and struggles to stand. The others look up at her.>//

**Dr. Okorie:** Where are you going?

**Chief Ibanez:** To get my answer.

[[=]]
@@ @@
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/the-b-b-decommission/Asterisk43.png]]
@@ @@
[[/=]]

//<Half an hour later, Chief Ibanez returns to the cave. The last of the living casualties have been brought inside, and Dr. McDoctorate is tinkering with the lights, attempting to get more wattage out of them.>//

//<This proves entirely unnecessary, as Chief Ibanez holds SCP-6500-SWORD over her head, and all present immediately shield their eyes from the intensity of its glow.>//

//<All save for Leandro Pelaez, who squints into the glare, and smiles.>//

**Leandro:** That's my daughter.

**Chief Ibanez:** You're goddamn right.

//<Transcript ends.>//
[[/div]]

Task Forces Command has officially reactivated PTF Delta-6500 under the command of Chief Ibanez, with Drs. Astrauskas and Okorie as operational assets and Dr. McDoctorate as consultant, and granted it purview over the Foundation's response to GoI-003 ("Chaos Resurgent"). 

FP-14 has been reclassified from neutralized to an active Free Port, and the residents of Zevala have unconditionally accepted Foundation protection. Reclassification of SCP-8273 from Terminarch is pending, as she is no longer the last of her kind.

As her new duties allow, Chief Ibanez has been unanimously nominated by all involved parties as the Foundation's liaison to FP-14. She has accepted. Her sister Pilar will represent the Free Port.

The 'severing' ritual has not been reimplemented.

Operation CICLO is closed.
